item.title: IO Interactive Showcase Featuring 007 First Light, Hitman, And MindsEye Announced For This Week
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/2025/06/02/io-interactive-showcase-featuring-007-first-light-hitman-and-mindseye-announced-for-this

Hitman: World of Assassination developer IO Interactive revealed earlier today that its in-development James Bond game is titled “007 First Light.” Now, the studio has announced its first-ever IOI Showcase. It will air this Friday, June 6, and feature Hitman, 007 First Light, Leslie Benzies’ MindsEye, and more.

“IO Interactive, the independent video game developer and publisher behind, among others, the internationally acclaimed Hitman franchise, has announced its first IOI Showcase, a live-streamed and in-person event revealing details from the celebrated game creator’s properties and its publishing branch, IOI Partners, including Hitman, MindsEye, and 007 First Light,” the announcement reads. “The event will be live-streamed from Los Angeles on IOI’s Twitch, YouTube, and TikTok channels starting Friday, June 6th, at [6 p.m. PT/9 p.m. ET].”

IO Interactive says the broadcast will feature trailers, announcements, gameplay demos, a live Q&A with key figures from the studio and Build A Rocket Boy, and more. In addition to game-related announcements, IO Interactive will also share a look at its proprietary game engine, Glacier.

Elsewhere in the announcement, IO Interactive CEO Hakan Abrak says, “IOI Showcase celebrates our 25-year history with the Hitman franchise and shares an in-depth look at the diverse future of our studio. We’ve prepared some truly exciting surprises.”

While waiting for the IOI Showcase, check out Game Informer’s schedule of summer gaming showcases, and then check out the name reveal of 007 First Light. After that, read Game Informer’s Hitman 3 review. 

Are you going to turn into the IOI Showcase this Friday? Let us know in the comments below!

item.title: Nintendo Releases First Look At Pokémon Scarlet And Violet Running At 60 FPS On Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/2025/06/02/nintendo-releases-first-look-at-pokemon-scarlet-and-violet-running-at-60-fps-on-switch-2

Last month, Nintendo detailed several Switch 2 updates coming to select Switch games, including Pokémon Scarlet and Violet. At the time, it said the games would get an update to increase resolution and frame rates on Switch. We later learned players can expect the games to run at 4K/60 FPS, and now, thanks to a new video uploaded on the Nintendo Today news app, we can see it in action.

Though we can’t embed the video here – it’s locked into the Nintendo Today! App – Wario64 on Bluesky posted a recording of the video that you can check out here.

As you can see, it’s quite transformative to see Pokémon Scarlet and Violet running at 60 FPS, especially if you’re familiar with how they run on Switch. The Switch 2 update has seemingly taken these games, which often dip well below 30 FPS in busier areas of Paldea, and given them the power to run at a seemingly stable 60 FPS. Despite the higher frame rate, the games still largely look the same, as you can’t rework an art style with increased resolution and 60 FPS gameplay.

Still, if you haven’t yet journeyed through Paldea, Switch 2 looks to be the best place to explore this region.

The Switch 2 launches this week, on Thursday, June 5. If you couldn’t secure a preorder, check out Game Informer’s list of all the retailers selling Switch 2 on launch day. After that, check out Game Informer’s 2025 Switch 2 game release schedule, and then read our round-up of everything you need to know about Switch 2.

Will you dip back into Pokémon Scarlet and Violet on Switch 2? Let us know in the comments below!
